title: Necklace of Bloodlust
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

|   |                                                                                                            |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A necklace made of bloodstained human and animal teeth, and something that appears to be a piece of spine. |

[![Necklace of bloodlust.png](/images/c/c4/Necklace_of_bloodlust.png)](/File:Necklace_of_bloodlust.png) ***the necklace of Bloodlust***

Forces [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") (on 50% of melee attacks)  
-3 [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence")  
+80 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") (Will++)  
+6 [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying")  
Extends berserk on 50% of kills for `(1 + 1d4) / 2` turns

## Desirability

The **necklace of Bloodlust**[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is definitely not the sort of item that a melee character would want to use regularly. While +6 slay and Will++ are excellent properties, the berserkitis makes it a risky piece of gear.

[Undead](/Undead "Undead") players, [Formicids](/Formicid "Formicid"), and those with [clarity](/Clarity "Clarity") are unaffected by \*Rage, which allows getting full advantage of Bloodlust's other properties. [Ranged weapon](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") users greatly appreciate this amulet too - ranged weapons benefit from slaying, but don't trigger the berserk. Casters, in a similar vein, can use this amulet for the Will++; the -3 intelligence penalty is too small to matter.

Even if you're a melee character who is affected by berserk, it can be a niche swapout. Swap it in whenever berserk is helpful, such as before taking on a [ghost vault](/Ghost_vault "Ghost vault")). Do note that it takes 5 turns to put on an amulet (and another 5 turns to remove one).

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), the amulet only forced berserk on 5% of melee attacks, but had evocable berserk.
- Prior to the removal of [curses](/Curse "Curse") in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), this item would curse on equip.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), this amulet's base type was an [amulet of rage](/Amulet_of_rage "Amulet of rage").
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), the amulet only gave +3 slaying and +40 magic resistance.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the amulet had a +2 strength buff was removed and only a -2 intelligence malus.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), the forced berserk chances were decreased from 9% to 5%.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), the amulet had a stealth penalty of -20.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), the amulet only gave 30 MR.
- In [0.12](/0.12 "0.12") the odds of the amulet causing berserk were changed.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [art-data.txt:1107](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.32.0/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L1107) (0.32.0)
